case_vignette: A 17-YEAR-OLD BOY IS BROUGHT TO THE PHYSICIAN BY HIS MOTHER BECAUSE OF INCREASINGLY WITHDRAWN BEHAVIOR FOR THE LAST TWO YEARS. HIS MOTHER REPORTS THAT IN THE LAST 2–3 YEARS OF HIGH SCHOOL, HER SON HAS SPENT MOST OF HIS TIME IN HIS ROOM PLAYING VIDEO GAMES. HE DOES NOT HAVE ANY FRIENDS AND HAS NEVER HAD A GIRLFRIEND. HE USUALLY REFUSES TO ATTEND FAMILY DINNER AND AVOIDS CONTACT WITH HIS SIBLINGS. THE PATIENT STATES THAT HE PREFERS BEING ON HIS OWN. WHEN ASKED HOW MUCH PLAYING VIDEO GAMES MEANS TO HIM, HE REPLIES THAT “IT'S OKAY.” WHEN HIS MOTHER STARTS CRYING DURING THE VISIT, HE APPEARS INDIFFERENT. PHYSICAL AND NEUROLOGIC EXAMINATIONS SHOW NO OTHER ABNORMALITIES. ON MENTAL STATUS EXAMINATION, HIS THOUGHT PROCESS IS ORGANIZED AND LOGICAL. HIS AFFECT IS FLATTENED.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've become increasingly withdrawn over the last two years and prefer to spend most of my time alone, usually playing video games in my room.
How old are you and are there any significant life changes or stressors that occurred when you first noticed these changes?
I am 17 years old, and there have not been any significant life changes or stressors mentioned when these changes began.
Do you experience any feelings of sadness, loss of interest in activities you previously enjoyed, or changes in your sleep or appetite?
I don't have many feelings towards activities, as I mentioned that playing video games, which I spend a lot of time on, is just "okay." No changes in sleep or appetite have been mentioned.
Have you noticed any difficulties with concentration or making decisions since experiencing these changes?
No difficulties with concentration or making decisions have been mentioned.
Do you have a family history of any mental health issues, such as depression, anxiety, or schizophrenia?
No family history of mental health issues has been mentioned.
Have you experienced any feelings of paranoia, hearing voices, or believing things that others say are not true?
No, I have not experienced feelings of paranoia, hearing voices, or believing things that others say are not true.
Final Diagnosis: Schizoid Personality Disorder

Significant life changes or stressors have not been reported around the time these changes started. The individual expresses a neutral attitude towards activities, including playing video games which they engage in frequently. There have been no mentions of changes in sleep or appetite. The individual has not experienced feelings of paranoia, hearing voices, or believing things that others say are not true.
